change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE self-repealed by s. 3, effective February 28, 2022.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Local Government Act;
declaration of a state of local emergency has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Emergency Program Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exception to and modification to by-election requirement
bcl:section.bcl:text: As an exception to section 54 (1) [by-elections] of the Act, a municipality may decide that a by-election is not to be held to fill a vacancy if all of the following circumstances apply:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the municipality has made a declaration of a state of local emergency and the declaration is in effect when a decision not to hold a by-election is made;
the number of remaining council members constitutes the quorum for the council of the municipality, as set under section 129 (1) [quorum for conducting business] of the Community Charter.

bcl:section.bcl:text: This regulation is repealed on February 28, 2022.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Local Government Act, R.S.B.C. 2015, c. 1, s. 167.1.]
